content.raw:
The following problems were encountered when following the setup instructions on a clean install of Ubuntu 14.04.5. This was tested on both a VM and a real machine, both having an Intel Core i7 and 12G of memory. Both had the same errors. These were tested after the correction for the missing valkyrie directory issue was resolved.

1. The directory  $HOME/.gazebo/models is required for step 11 to complete and it does not exist. I created the directory and it continued without error. Is there a missing step that should have created this directory?

2. The line:
   source /opt/nasa/indigo/setup.bash
should have been run before step 12 in order to setup the environment. Should this line have been added to the default startup bash script?

3. The rosrun command is missing from the default install and creates an error in the "test your installation" script. I installed this with:
   sudo apt-get install ros-indigo-rosbash
and it passed the error.
